result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry L. Parker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerry L. Parker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerry L. Parker was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Ct.5 in 15CF1215 but Concurrent to Ct.3 in 15CF1215.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Do not reside with any person of the opposite sex without Court's permission.  May not have contact with Victim.

Minutes:  15CF961/15CF1215.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Leon Todd.  Court conducts colliquey with deft regarding his jeopardy rights; Court finds deft waived jeopardy.  Atty Todd orally withdraws the claim re:  DNA surcharge.  Testimony taken from Atty Diane Caspari & deft.  Exhibits #1 & #2 offered/received.  Defense rests.  No evidence presented by the State.  Court finds the deft's motion is without merit; therefore, the deft's post conviction motion is denied for the reasons set forth on the record.  Atty Todd to prepare order for the court's signature.

Minutes:  15CF961/15CF1215.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.

15CF1215 - (Ct 5) - deft sentenced to 8yrs WSP; initial confinement of 4yrs followed by 4yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 235 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.   (Ct 3) - sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years consecutive to count 5.  Probation conditions to be identical to those of ES.

12CF961 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years consecutive to count 5 in 12CF1215 but concurrent to count 3 in 15CF1215.

Any bond posted shall be applied towards financial obligations
DNA ordered; notice given to deft
Appeal rights
Firearm warning
Voting acknowledgment.

Minutes:  15CF961/15CF1215.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Motion hrg continued.  Testimony taken from deft.  Defense rests.  No evidence presented by the State.  Arguments heard.  Deft's motion to withdraw plea is denied.  Sentencing set for 8/3/16 @ 11am.

Minutes:  15CF961/15CF1215.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Deft waives jeopardy. Minutes:  15CF1177/15CF961/15CF1215.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  State was not provided with a copy of deft's motion to withdraw plea; copy provided in court today.  Arguments heard on deft's motion to withdraw plea.  Defense counsel moves to w/draw as counsel; motion needs to be in writing.  Mtn/sentencing hrg continued to 5/24/16 @ 1:30pm.  Defense to file her motion to withdraw by 4/28/16.  Defense counsel should obtain a copy of the plea hrg transcript prior to the next hrg.  Court suggests the deft cooperate with the PSI writer.

15CF961 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.

15CF1215 - deft pleads no contest to count 3 & guilty to count 5; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/14/16 @ 1:30pm.

Minutes:  15CF961/15CF1215.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Atty Caspari moves to w/draw as counsel.  Discussion held.  Court takes a short recess to allow the deft and defense counsel to confer.  Court reconvenes.  Defense counsel reports the deft wishes Atty Caspari to continue as his counsel.  State requests another FPT.  FPT set for 2/12/16 @ 10am.  State will be filing a motion to consolidate.  Court will address the motion to consolidate at the next hrg.

Defendant, Jerry L. Parker, appeared with Attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.   Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   ST called witness KPD Ofc Paul Chase; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Caspari. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial to Br 3. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
